intro: Phoebe corzoana, commonly known as the Mexican beech, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and smooth, dark bark. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance. Phoebe corzoana produces small, fragrant flowers followed by small, round berries that are an important food source for local wildlife.
